titles.title: A bill to repeal section 10(f) of Public Law 93-531, commonly known as the "Bennett Freeze".

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S55)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Senate Committee on Indian Affairs discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Mrs. Christensen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 39.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

bill.summary: 5/8/2009--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Amends federal law to repeal the requirement regarding the freeze on the development of lands in litigation under the Navajo-Hopi Settlement Act of 1974.
